data.title: KKIC hosts "PlaRa MorLam Isan '24" to boost local identity and sustainability
data.description:
KKIC joins hands with the Thai Chamber of Commerce and Khon Kaen Province to continue the concept of 'Joining Together, Prospering Together' by organizing an event "PlaRa MorLam Isan to the World'24"
to raise the level of local identity, promote economic, social, and community sustainability

data.title: Carbon Markets Club signs MoC at COP29 to support ASEAN carbon framework
data.description: Five major carbon market associations from Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia, Singapore, and ASEAN signed a Memorandum of Collaboration (MoC) at the 29th Conference of the Parties (COP29) held in Baku, Azerbaijan.

data.title: Thailand, China unveil Golden Jubilee logo
data.description: Logo to mark 50 years of Sino-Thai diplomatic ties unveiled

data.title: ITA Airways launches nonstop flights from Bangkok to Rome
data.description: A true ambassador of "Made in Italy", ITA Airways unveiled brand, network, and Winter Season highlights during a media event in Bangkok

data.title: Foreigner falls to death at Korat mall
data.description: NAKHON RATCHASIMA - A foreign man has fallen to his death from the fourth floor of the Terminal 21 Korat shopping mall.

data.title: True and Partners Enhance Safety with Cell Broadcast System
data.description: True Corporation Plc., Thailand’s leading telecom-tech company, joined forces with the National Broadcasting and Telecommunications Commission (NBTC), Ministry of Digital Economy and Society (DE), Department of Disaster Prevention and Mitigation (DDPM), and Phuket Province to conduct a live simulation of the “LIVE – Cell Broadcast Service” (CBS) in Phuket on 19 November 2024. This initiative is designed to elevate safety standards in one of Thailand’s most prominent tourist destinations and bolster visitor confidence.

data.title: Sabotage feared as Baltic Sea cables cut
data.description: Two undersea fibre-optic communications cables in the Baltic Sea, including one linking Finland and Germany, have been severed, raising suspicions of sabotage, the countries and companies involved say.

data.title: Cat owner, others in poisoning scene face cruelty charges
data.description: The Department of Livestock Development has completed its inquiry into the use of a drugged cat in the production of a Thai period drama, and the cat’s owner and other people involved will be charged with animal cruelty.

data.title: Govt vows to roll out 10,000 baht handout for elderly by January
data.description: The second phase will cover about 4 million people and should be delivered no later than Chinese New Year, promises finance minister

data.title: Will the Thai Baht Decline Further in 2024?
data.description: In the lead-up to the US election, the Baht rose steadily throughout 2024 but saw a significant shift at the end of September. It has since dropped by 7% and appears likely to continue depreciating. So, what happened?

data.title: SEC, SET stress goal of restoring confidence in Thai capital market
data.description: Task spearheaded by Wisit Wisitsora-at, chairman of SEC since taking office five months ago

data.title: ONESIAM SuperApp Elevates Shopping with Exclusive Member Rewards
data.description: ONESIAM SuperApp advances its smart platform transformation, elevating a universe of extraordinary experiences to new heights. It’s now set to deliver unparalleled privileges for valued customers of prestigious global projects. Siam Paragon, Siam Center, Siam Discovery, ICONSIAM, ICS, and Siam Premium Outlets Bangkok are joining forces with leading partners across diverse industries, including premium and luxury brands within the world-class premium business ecosystem. Together, they are creating unparalleled privileges and valuable experiences exclusively for ONESIAM members.

data.title: The Grand Return of “Pattaya International Jazz Festival 2024”
data.description: “Pattaya City” is set to host the grand-scale “Pattaya International Jazz Festival 2024” under the theme “The Harmonic Jazz & Beach.” This event will feature a free concert by world-renowned jazz artist Ronan Keating alongside numerous international and Thai jazz musicians, aiming to elevate Pattaya City to global prominence. The event is scheduled to take place on December 6 – 7, 2024, from 5:00 PM to midnight at Pattaya Beach, Chonburi.

data.title: Prime minister congratulates Donald Trump on election victory
data.description: In phone call to Trump, Paetongtarn Shinawatra affirms Thailand's readiness to work with US

data.title: Thai rice prices surge in 2024 as demand outstrips supply
data.description: Commerce Ministry reports that export prices have risen by up to 24% in boost for farmers

data.title: 3 arrested as police crack counterfeit Ensure Gold milk operation
data.description: Police in Nakhon Pathom arrested 2 Thais, and one Chinese after uncovering a fake milk powder operation, which cost the brand more than 4.5 million baht in lost sales

data.title: Proposal to serve alcohol on Thai trains sparks safety debate
data.description: Move to boost tourism and revenue could also lead to disorderly behaviour and accidents, critics say

data.title: Maori rights rally draws thousands in New Zealand
data.description: WELLINGTON - Tens of thousands of New Zealanders rallied in front of parliament on Tuesday in one of the country’s largest ever protests to oppose a bill, which opponents say seeks to dilute the rights of Maori and threatens to set race relations back decades.

data.title: C.P. Group Partners with Zhejiang University to Drive Innovation
data.description: C.P. Group and Zhejiang University have joined forces to advance human capital development, innovation, and research across multiple disciplines, supporting global efforts to achieve a sustainable future.

data.title: Aussie women gravely ill from tainted booze in Laos
data.description: Two young Australian women are fighting for their lives in Thai hospitals after drinking  tainted alcohol  in the tourist town of Vang Vieng in Laos.

data.title: Public outcry of animal cruelty lands Thai TV series in hot water
data.description: A scene depicting a vomiting, writhing black cat that eventually goes lifeless sparks ire, but checks show the feline in fine fettle

data.title: Chaiwat found not guilty in defamation case filed by ex-DNP chief
data.description: The criminal court said the DNP official was acting in his official capacity when he led a sting operation to expose Ratchada’s alleged bribery demands

data.title: Yingluck must comply with law if she is to return, Thawee says
data.description: Thaksin has said exiled ex-PM Yingluck plans to return for next year’s Songkran festival

data.title: Political battle heats up in Sisaket
data.description: Pheu Thai going all out, aiming to settle scores with Bhumjaithai Party

data.title: Suriya reveals latest on Khao Kradong issue in Buri Ram
data.description: Minister of transport says State Railway of Thailand has complied with court rulings in the matter

data.title: Erawan Bangkok turns twenty with new look
data.description: Erawan Bangkok has finally finished its revamp process and boasts various tenants to live up to its “Eat-Play-Live” concept.

data.title: Sweden Leads Waste Management, Inspiring Thailand’s e-Waste Future
data.description: Sweden stands as one of the world’s most efficient nations in waste management, driven by the principle that "there is no such thing as waste, only resources out of place." This philosophy has been fully embraced through comprehensive policies, legislation, and collaboration across all sectors of society, transforming Sweden into a nation that is nearly free of waste.

data.title: Trump’s policies may spell economic uncertainty for Thailand: NESDC
data.description: Trade barriers, fluctuating currency rates and tightened immigration policies could impact Thailand’s export sector and the broader economy, says the council

data.title: Uno Mas hosts special dinners for two nights only
data.description: Chef Yoshitsugu Yamamoto, the owner of the Michelin-starred Alarde in Osaka, Japan, will take over Uno Mas at Centara Grand at CentralWorld for two nights on Nov 21-22.

data.title: IRPC and PTT Group Build an Organisation of “Good and Talented People” at PTT Group CG Day 2024
data.description: On November 6, 2024, Mr. Terdkiat Prommool, President and Chief Executive Officer; Asst. Prof. Dr. Chaiyaporn Puprasert, Chairman of the Corporate Governance and Sustainability Committee; Mr. Komol Buaket, Member of the Corporate Governance and Sustainability Committee; and Dr. Buranin Rattanasombat, Member of the Risk Management Committee, IRPC Public Co., Ltd., and Chief New Business and Sustainability Officer, PTT Public Co., Ltd., together with executives and employees of IRPC and the PTT Group, united in promoting business driven by corporate governance principles at the 16  th  PTT Group CG Day 2024. The event, themed “CG Citizen Sustainability Connect: Open, Link, and Transparent,” emphasised conducting business in accordance with good governance principles (CG) to adapt to modern changes while balancing the interests of all stakeholders.

data.title: Fashion designer princess showcases her new collection
data.description: The latest designs for men and women by Her Royal Highness Princess Sirivannavari take a bow at the National Art Gallery

data.title: MG, Mercedes win top awards in Thailand for automotive excellence
data.description: MG3 Hybrid+ and Mercedes EQS 450 SUV win best vehicles awards for their outstanding design, innovation and performance

data.title: Barrier experiment spurs hope for seagrass recovery in Trang
data.description: Efforts to restore seagrass beds accelerate to address the dwindling food supply for the rapidly declining dugong population in the region

data.title: Thaksin expects fugitive sister Yingluck to return by April
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra expects his younger sister, fugitive former prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra, to return to Thailand around April next year.

data.title: Chiang Mai krathong waste drops 25%
data.description: CHIANG MAI - Twenty-five tonnes of krathong floats and garbage have been collected from the Ping River after Friday’s  Loy Krathong  festival, down from 33 tonnes last year.

data.title: Thailand Data Centers Surge as AI Meets Green Goals
data.description: Thailand

data.title: Thai PM Paetongtarn speaks with Trump
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra had a phone call with US President-elect Donald Trump, her office said on Tuesday, during which they both pledged to support each others’ administrations.

data.title: Rhapsody In Blue – a timeless American classic
data.description: On Feb 12, 1924, a concert organised by popular jazz band leader Paul Whiteman was held at the Aeolian Hall in New York City. Despite the cold and snow, the show was jam-packed not only with music fans but also composers like Sergei Rachmaninov and John Philip Souza and popular actors like Gertrude Lawrence.
